content.description: Rappel in and start this route at the base of the large spruce tree.  Climb up bolts and onto crack with gear options.  When the crack fades continue up bolts to the top and finish on a two bolt anchor.  Some of the loose flakes were cleaned off the wall so we feel free to put some grade feedback on the site.
content.protection: Mostly bolts with some trap placements if need be to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: climb tenuous and sometimes poor quality slab past bolts, pull the moves through the roof well protected by bolts.

Rappel to the base of the climb. This route is located about 30 feet form Face In The Crowd.  It follows a thin crack till the seam splits into three.  All the cracks are protect able and go at a similar grade.  Use small cams, Micro nuts and maybe a few Knife blades.
content.protection: Bring small trad gear, maybe a few knife blades and webbing to make a tree anchor to rap down to the start of the route.

content.description: This route is the first two bolt anchor you come to. Rap in and climb the slab past bad bolts to the roof. pull the well protected roof past loose blocks into a short crack to the anchor.
content.location: climbers right of the large corner.

content.description: Use the same approach as Ant Eater or rap in off the anchor.  Start the route below and right of a large block located on the upper part of the wall.  Climb up a short corner to a thin crack.  Place gear and continue up and left towards the block.  Follow bolts and fixed pins to the roof and exit out right or pull the roof if your feeling strong.
content.protection: Bolts, fixed pins, small wires, and cams will get you to the two bolt anchor.

content.description: This is the route that lies below a dead spruce tree located at the top of the cliff.  Build an anchor off live trees and rap in.  Then Climb past 5 bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Five bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: Second route starting from the left.

content.description: Start this route by rappelling in off of two bolts located just below the knife edge section of the approach trail.  Be careful of a small bee hive that was hanging from some alders that the base in the summer of 2013. Pull the rope and lead up past a bit of moss and onto great rock.  Climb past three bolts and a fixed pin.  Then plug some gear into a small crack till the rock fades back to face climbing. Past three more bolts and continue on to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts, a Fixed Pin and trad gear to 1.5"  Two bolt anchor.

content.description: The Tsaina wall is an amazing crag located on the steep rock just above the raging Tsaina River.  It consists of half a dozen routes with Ant Eater and Jacobs Ladder being classic in quality.  The wall receives lots of sun and has only a few minute approach yet this beautiful setting makes it seem a word away form civilization.
